meanings.definition: Acting in a frenzied or chaotic manner.
meanings.sent1: The madding crowd rushed towards the stage.
meanings.sent2: The madding wind blew the leaves in all directions.
meanings.sent3: Trying to calm down the madding children in the playground was a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The madding storm wreaked havoc on the small town.
meanings.sent5: The madding chaos of the city streets was overwhelming.

meanings.sent1: Her madding comments made him lose his temper.
meanings.sent2: The madding noise from the construction site disrupted the peace.
meanings.sent3: Dealing with the madding traffic during rush hour was exhausting.
meanings.sent4: The madding delay in the train schedule annoyed the passengers.
meanings.sent5: The madding buzzing of the mosquito kept her awake all night.

meanings.definition: Characterized by wild or uncontrollable behavior.
meanings.sent1: The madding horse galloped wildly across the field.
meanings.sent2: The madding puppy ran around the house in excitement.
meanings.sent3: The madding squirrel caused chaos in the garden by digging up plants.
meanings.sent4: The madding river flooded its banks after heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The madding behavior of the children at the party required constant supervision.
